comments:
I receive a java.lang.NullPointerException error in BIRT 2.2RC0 when attempting to view or edit existing property bindings in a report from BIRT 2.2M6.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Launch BIRT 2.2RC0 and open a report created in BIRT 2.2M6 that includes a data set with property bindings.

2. Right-click a data set that has property bindings and select Edit

3. Click on the "Property Bindings" text in the left-hand pane.

I was able to reproduce this error on a co-workers machine, also running BIRT 2.2RC0, using any of our reports from BIRT 2.2M6 that contained property bindings.

Actual results:

An error dialog appears citing a java.lang.NullPointerException. The right-hand pane is not populated with the property bindings controls. Instead, it retains whatever it contained before the error (the Query editor by default). 

This error does not occur if there are no property bindings entered or if the property bindings were originally entered in BIRT 2.2RC0. Also, the error does not appear to effect report execution; the report runs as expected, and the property bindings are still applied at run time as expected. I simply can't edit them in the BIRT designer.

Expected results:

The Property Bindings controls should have appeared in the right-hand pane with no errors.

Build version: 

Eclipse BIRT Designer Version 2.2.0.v20070403 Build <2.2.0.v20070406-0959

Additional information:

Below are the contents of the meta.log file in my eclipse directory after the error occurred. If any other logs should be included, please let me know where to find them and I will update this entry.

Or can you please try the latest build?

Created an attachment (id=70093)
template file crashes BIRT designer

I've got the same error when opening this file
oh! it seems that meta.log always contain this error stack. So my problem not corresponds with the Jason's one.
Have tried latest build? The error in meta.log should have been fixed.
I'm using 2.2RC0. Should I try nigthly build?

Sergey,

Problems in your report still exist. They are different from that of Jason's report. So, no need to test in the latest build.

Thanks.

For the design file with obsolete version number, if the name contains invalid characters, automatically renames it during parsing. 

Sergey, by using the build after 20070605, you should be able to open the design file.
Thanx! It seems 2.2 RC0 doesn't like russian characters at all.
Cannot reproduce this problem and cannot get Jason's report. Close this bug for now.

Created an attachment (id=72600)
Sample database report to demonstrate the property binding error

Sorry about the delay. I'm unable to provide my original reports, but I was able to reproduce the error by creating a simple report on the sample database. 

I created the report in 2.2M6 and added a report parameter (productLine). I added a script to the report initialize event that populates a global productLineClause variable with a WHERE clause if the productLine parameter is not an empty string. Next, I added a property binding to the mainQuery data set that includes the original query with the productLineClause variable concatenated in just before the ORDER BY. Finally, I opened the report in 2.2RC4 and saved it as a new file. I made no other changes at this point.

Follow these steps to reproduce the null pointer exception error:

1. Open the attached PropertyBindingError_22RC4.rptdesign file in BIRT 2.2RC4.
2. Double click the mainQuery data set to open its edit dialog.
3. Click the "Property Binding" menu item in the left-hand pane.

A java.lang.nullPointerException should occur at this point, and the property binding controls fail to appear in the right-hand pane.

Once a time OdaConnProfileName and OdaConnProfileStorePath are defined on OdaDataSet. However, currently, they were removed from OdaDataSet. This caused this NPE problem.

BIRT codes should avoid NPE anyway. Reassign to Data Team for the fix.
